title: Love Language Test
description: How do you express and receive love? Discover your primary love language!

questions.question: When do you feel happiest with your partner?

choices.text: When they say 'I love you' or give compliments
When they hold your hand or hug you
When they give you a surprise gift
When they spend quality time with you
When they do something helpful for you

questions.question: What do you want most on anniversaries?

choices.text: A surprise they prepared for you

questions.question: When you're going through a hard time, what helps most?

choices.text: Buying you food or something you like

questions.question: When do you feel disappointed with your partner?

choices.text: When there's no praise or encouragement
When there's not enough time together
When they don't help with requests
Frequently saying 'I love you' and giving compliments

questions.question: What's your most memorable romantic memory?

choices.text: A sweet moment of physical affection
A trip or special time together

questions.question: In a long-distance relationship, what's most important?

choices.text: Doing things for each other when meeting

questions.question: When making up after a fight...

choices.text: Treating me to something nice helps
Actions need to show they're sorry

questions.question: When giving relationship advice to friends, you say...

results.title: Words of Affirmation
results.description: Your love language is Words of Affirmation! Hearing 'I love you,' compliments, encouragement, and expressions of gratitude means the world to you. Sincere words fill your heart, while criticism or dismissive words can deeply hurt. You also love expressing love verbally to your partner.

results.title: Physical Touch
results.description: Your love language is Physical Touch! Holding hands, hugging, and physical contact make you feel loved. You find security and love through touch rather than words. Without physical affection, you may feel lonely.

results.title: Receiving Gifts
results.description: Your love language is Receiving Gifts! It's not about expensive presents, but the thought and effort behind them. Anniversary gifts and small surprises make you feel loved. You see gifts as symbols of your partner's love.

results.title: Quality Time
results.description: Your love language is Quality Time! Having someone's undivided attention and doing things together is the greatest expression of love. You feel loved through conversations and shared activities, and may feel unloved when time isn't made for you.

results.title: Acts of Service
results.description: Your love language is Acts of Service! Actions speak louder than words for you. Cooking, helping with chores, running errands - these actions express love more than words ever could. You value love shown through deeds.
